body.p: Which of the following would not be transported by the hepatic portal vein to the liver after absorption in the small intestine?

response.feedback: Incorrect. These are absorbed by co-transport and facilitated diffusion into capillary blood in villi.
Incorrect. These are absorbed mainly in the ileum and recycled by the hepatocytes.
Correct. These are absorbed into the lacteals that return to the subclavian veins, not the hepatic portal vein.
Incorrect. These are absorbed by co-transport into capillary blood in villi.

part.hint: Review how the different organic compounds, once absorbed, are transported. One is transported in the lymphatic system instead of the blood.
